content:
Artistic value is subjective, and individuals have different tastes and preferences when it comes to music. While you may not appreciate experimental music or find it to have artistic value, others may see it differently. 

Experimental music challenges traditional artistic norms, creates new forms of musical expression, and often requires a deep understanding of music theory and composition. It's a form of art that is intended to provoke thought and emotion in the listener and can be seen as a reflection of the world around us.

It's also worth noting that experimental music has influenced and inspired many other musical genres that are widely enjoyed today. So even if you don't enjoy experimental music, it continues to make a significant impact on the evolution of music as a whole.

Ultimately, art is subjective, and it's okay to have different opinions and preferences. However, it's important to recognize and respect the artistic value and significance that experimental music has had and continues to have in the world of music.
